result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Ct authorized bench warrant for non-appearance
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at the Wisco bar.
Trial Judge - Br 7 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

1:37 PM Defendant Brandon C Blain Jr in court, in custody from the Columbia County Jail via Zoom.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Brandon C Blain Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant has not received a copy of the Complaint and waived receipt. COURT TO MAIL COPY OF COMPLAINT TO DEFENDANT WITH BOND FORMS. Defense moved to dismiss Count 1, made argument. Objection and argument by State. State moved to amend Count 1 to 946.41(1) OBSTRUCTION from RESISTING. No objection by defense. COURT AMENDED COUNT 1. Defense withdrew motion to dismiss. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
IA via zoom from Columbia Co Jail

11:09 AM Defendant Brandon C Blain Jr not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is currently in custody in the Columbia County jail. State to schedule for in-custody Initial Appearance.
Initial appearance on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:27 AM Defendant did not appear.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State unable to provide evidence of sufficient personal service of notice for hearing. Court rescheduled Initial Appearance, State to issue Summons (or other attempt at service).
